tables: Telephone Dialling Codes in the United Kingdom
List of United Kingdom dialing codes
Non-geographic numbers charged at standard geographic area code rates (introduced in 2007)
Corporate numbering andVoIPservices; toll-free services (0500) until June 2017
Mobile telephony (071xx–075xx and 077xx–079xx),personal numbering(070xx), non-UK mobile networks (07624) and pagers (076xx)

(01xx xx) xxxx(01xxx) xx xxx0800 xxx xxx
local numbers cannot begin with 4, 5 or 6
local numbers cannot begin with 3, 4 or 7
local numbers cannot begin with 3, 4 or 7
County ofTyne and Wear, easternCounty Durham,south-easternNorthumberland
formerly 0386 (Durham; 38 = DU), 0632 (North Tyneside/Newcastle; 63 = NE), 0783 (Sunderland; 78 = SU) and 894 (South Tyneside; 89 = TY);091(9 = tYne) from 1982
Mobile phones on the Isle of Man
Number range for data-only services (e.g. 3G/LTE-enabled tablet computers, portable modem routers, data devices, etc.)
Pagers (excluding 07624, used for mobile phones on the Isle of Man)
For qualifying public bodies and non-profit organisations as defined by Ofcom
Migration range for operators who have 084x numbers
Migration range for operators who have 087x numbers
Corporate Numbering (but also used by BT for its Broadband Voice service)
Allocated by Ofcom for LIECS (Location Independent Electronic Communications Services), e.g.VoIPservices
Special Services – No charge to Customer a.k.a. "Freephone"
Free to call from landline, up to 40p per minute from mobile.
Special Services – No charge to Customer a.k.a. "Freephone"

Free to call from landline, and was up to 40p per minute from mobile, until July 2015 when calls to 080 numbers from mobiles became free. Calls to certain charity and similar services were always free from most mobiles.08089xx xxxx numbers are used by freephone internet services.
Up to 5p a minute, varies daytime/evening/weekend, from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 42p a minute from mobiles.
Non-BT Discount Scheme—Internet Services incorporating unmetered access up to and including 5p for BT customers
Up to 4.26p a minute (plus VAT), varies daytime/evening/weekend, from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 42p a minute from mobiles.
Up to 4.26p a minute (plus VAT), but fixed (e.g. always 3p/minute or always 4p/minute) from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 42p a minute from mobiles.
Up to 4.26p a minute (plus VAT), but fixed (e.g. always 3p/minute or always 4p/minute) from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 42p a minute from mobiles.
Up to 8p a minute (plus VAT), varies daytime/evening/weekend (charged at no more than the caller would pay for a call to a Geographic Number) from landline; up to 42p a minute from mobiles.
Internet Services metered access, up to and including 10p/minute for BT customers.
Up to 8.5p a minute (plus VAT) but fixed (e.g. always 6p/minute or always 8.5p/minute) from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 50p a minute from mobiles.
Up to 8.5p a minute (plus VAT) but fixed (e.g. always 6p/minute or always 8.5p/minute) from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 50p a minute from mobiles.
Up to 8.5p a minute (plus VAT) but fixed (e.g. always 6p/minute or always 8.5p/minute) from BT landline, other providers may charge more; up to 50p a minute from mobiles.
Sexual entertainment services (SES) (not available for new allocations)
Wave Telecom mobile phones, not for UK
caller may press 3 to return call on most networks
removes details of last call from 1471 service.  May need to be prefixed with 1470 if number is normally withheld
Stores number (even if withheld) of nuisance caller at terminating exchange for subsequent investigation and enforcement,but service is seldom enabled by default
For people who do not have answering machines.If there is a new message, the dial tone will be stuttered.
To divert nuisance calls to junk voicemail.
141 equivalent for use on mobile networks
